headline.main: North Korea Reopens Borders After Months-Long Ebola Shutdown
headline.print_headline: North Korea Reopens Borders After Months-Long Ebola Shutdown

docs.snippet: North Korea officially reopened its borders on Tuesday to foreign tourists and businessmen nearly five months after shutting them over fear of the deadly Ebola virus, tour agencies and a diplomatic source told Reuters....
docs.lead_paragraph: North Korea officially reopened its borders on Tuesday to foreign tourists and businessmen nearly five months after shutting them over fear of the deadly Ebola virus, tour agencies and a diplomatic source told Reuters.

headline.main: A Refugee Embraces a Visual Language

docs.snippet: As a young refugee unfamiliar with a new language, Sylvia Plachy learned to watch her surroundings. A new retrospective tracks 50 years of her journey....
docs.lead_paragraph: As a young refugee unfamiliar with a new language, Sylvia Plachy learned to watch her surroundings. A new retrospective tracks 50 years of her journey.

headline.main: No. 6 Baylor Ends Regular Season 75-65 Over Texas Tech
headline.print_headline: No. 6 Baylor Ends Regular Season 75-65 Over Texas Tech

docs.snippet: Nina Davis scored 22 points and Niya Johnson broke the Big 12 single-season record for assists as league champion No. 6 Baylor rebounded from consecutive losses, beating Texas Tech 75-65 in the regular-season finale Monday night....
docs.lead_paragraph: Nina Davis scored 22 points and Niya Johnson broke the Big 12 single-season record for assists as league champion No. 6 Baylor rebounded from consecutive losses, beating Texas Tech 75-65 in the regular-season finale Monday night.

headline.main: Man Who Tried to Scale White House Barrier Won't Be Charged
headline.print_headline: Man Who Tried to Scale White House Barrier Won't Be Charged

docs.snippet: A man charged with trying to climb a barrier set up outside the White House has entered into an agreement with prosecutors to have his case dismissed....
docs.lead_paragraph: A man charged with trying to climb a barrier set up outside the White House has entered into an agreement with prosecutors to have his case dismissed.

headline.sub: Buffett's no holds barred shareholder letter

docs.snippet: Warren Buffett, the chairman and chief executive of Berkshire Hathaway, weighs in on the terrible reputations of some conglomerates, Costco’s new credit card deal, and private equity....
docs.lead_paragraph: Warren Buffett, the chairman and chief executive of Berkshire Hathaway, weighs in on the terrible reputations of some conglomerates, Costco’s new credit card deal, and private equity.

headline.main: United Airlines Won't Accept Rechargeable Battery Shipments
headline.print_headline: United Airlines Won't Accept Rechargeable Battery Shipments

docs.snippet: Citing safety concerns, United Airlines on Monday became the second major U.S. airline to announce it will no longer accept bulk shipments of rechargeable batteries of the kind that power everything from smartphones to laptops to power tools....
docs.lead_paragraph: Citing safety concerns, United Airlines on Monday became the second major U.S. airline to announce it will no longer accept bulk shipments of rechargeable batteries of the kind that power everything from smartphones to laptops to power tools.

headline.main: Bus Carrying China Opera Troupe Falls Off Cliff, Killing 20
headline.print_headline: Bus Carrying China Opera Troupe Falls Off Cliff, Killing 20

docs.snippet: A bus carrying an opera troupe fell off a cliff in central China on Tuesday, killing 20 people and injuring 13, state media reported....
docs.lead_paragraph: A bus carrying an opera troupe fell off a cliff in central China on Tuesday, killing 20 people and injuring 13, state media reported.

headline.main: Jack's Jumper Gives Nets 110-108 Win Over Curry, Warriors
headline.print_headline: Jack's Jumper Gives Nets 110-108 Win Over Curry, Warriors

docs.snippet: There was no stopping Stephen Curry down the stretch, so Jarrett Jack shot over him....
docs.lead_paragraph: There was no stopping Stephen Curry down the stretch, so Jarrett Jack shot over him.

headline.main: Australia to Send 300 More Troops to Iraq on Training Mission
headline.print_headline: Australia to Send 300 More Troops to Iraq on Training Mission

docs.snippet: Australia will send an additional 300 soldiers to help train Iraqi forces fighting Islamic State militants, Prime Minister Tony Abbott said on Tuesday, following a request from the United States to contribute to an international training coalition...
docs.lead_paragraph: Australia will send an additional 300 soldiers to help train Iraqi forces fighting Islamic State militants, Prime Minister Tony Abbott said on Tuesday, following a request from the United States to contribute to an international training coalition.
